@description.name: @description
@description.body:
List Controller

General idea The list controller is responsible for synchronizing every list like widget with a data array. It does not matter if the array contains atomic values like strings of complete objects where one property holds the value for the label and another property holds the icon url. You can even use converters that make the label show a text corresponding to the icon, by binding both label and icon to the same model property and converting one of them. Features

  • Synchronize the model and the target
  • Label and icon are bindable
  • Takes care of the selection
  • Passes on the options used by {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} Usage As model, only {@link qx.data.Array}s do work. The currently supported targets are
  • {@link qx.ui.form.SelectBox}
  • {@link qx.ui.form.List}
  • {@link qx.ui.form.ComboBox} All the properties like model, target or any property path is bindable. Especially the model is nice to bind to another selection for example. The controller itself can only work if it has a model and a target set. The rest of the properties may be empty. Cross reference
  • If you want to bind single values, use {@link qx.data.controller.Object}
  • If you want to bind a tree widget, use {@link qx.data.controller.Tree}
  • If you want to bind a form widget, use {@link qx.data.controller.Form}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: model {qx.data.Array?null} The array containing the data.
@param.description: The array containing the data.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
target {qx.ui.core.Widget?null} The widget which should show the
   ListItems.
@param.description:
The widget which should show the
   ListItems.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
labelPath {String?null} If the model contains objects, the labelPath
   is the path reference to the property in these objects which should be
   shown as label.
@param.description:
If the model contains objects, the labelPath
   is the path reference to the property in these objects which should be
   shown as label.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Data array containing the data which should be shown in the list.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The target widget which should show the data.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The path to the property which holds the information that should be shown as a label. This is only needed if objects are stored in the model.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The path to the property which holds the information that should be shown as an icon. This is only needed if objects are stored in the model and if the icon should be shown.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A map containing the options for the label binding. The possible keys can be found in the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding} documentation.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A map containing the options for the icon binding. The possible keys can be found in the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding} documentation.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Delegation object, which can have one or more functions defined by the {@link IControllerDelegate} interface.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether a special "null" value is included in the list

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Title for the special null value entry

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Icon for the special null value entry

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Data array containing the selected model objects. This property can be manipulated directly which means that a push to the selection will also select the corresponding element in the target.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The owning object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {String} The ID of the object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Updates the filter and the target. This could be used if the filter uses an additional parameter which changes the filter result.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: If a new delegate is set, it applies the stored configuration for the list items to the already created list items once.

@param.description: The old delegate.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Refreshes the model, uses when the model and target are not changing but the appearance and bindings may need to be updated

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Apply-method which will be called if the model has been changed. It removes all the listeners from the old model and adds the needed listeners to the new model. It also invokes the initial filling of the target widgets if there is a target set.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {qx.data.Array|null} The new model array.
@param.description: The new model array.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: old {qx.data.Array|null} The old model array.
@param.description: The old model array.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Apply-method which will be called if the target has been changed. When the target changes, every binding needs to be reset and the old target needs to be cleaned up. If there is a model, the target will be filled with the data of the model.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {qx.ui.core.Widget|null} The new target.
@param.description: The new target.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: old {qx.ui.core.Widget|null} The old target.
@param.description: The old target.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for the change event of the model. If the model changes, Only the selection needs to be changed. The change of the data will be done by the binding.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for the changeModel of the model. Updates the controller.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal method used to sync the selection. The controller uses the widget queue to schedule the selection update. An asynchronous handling of the selection is needed because the bindings (event listeners for the binding) need to be executed before the selection is updated.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for the changeLength of the model. If the length changes of the model, either ListItems need to be removed or added to the target.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper method which removes and adds the change listener of the controller to the model. This is sometimes necessary to ensure that the listener of the controller is executed as the last listener of the chain.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates a ListItem and delegates the configure method if a delegate is set and the needed function (configureItem) is available.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.form.ListItem} The created and configured ListItem.
@return.description: The created and configured ListItem.

@description.name: @description

@param.body: index {Number} The index of the item to add.
@param.description: The index of the item to add.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal helper to remove ListItems from the target. Also the binding will be removed properly.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns all models currently visible by the list. This method is only useful if you use the filter via the {@link #delegate}.

{qx.data.Array} A new data array container all the models
   which representation items are currently visible.
@return.description:
A new data array container all the models

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Apply-Method for setting the filter. It removes all bindings, check if the length has changed and adds or removes the items in the target. After that, the bindings will be set up again and the selection will be updated.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {Function|null} The new filter function.
@param.description: The new filter function.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: old {Function|null} The old filter function.
@param.description: The old filter function.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This helper is responsible for removing the filter and setting the controller to a valid state without a filtering.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper-Method which builds up the index lookup for the filter feature. If no filter is set, the lookup table will be a 1:1 mapping.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Function for accessing the lookup table.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} The index of the lookup table.
@param.description: The index of the lookup table.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number} Item index from lookup table
@return.description: Item index from lookup table

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property selection. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #selection}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property selection. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #selection}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property selection. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #selection}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: setValue implements part of the {@link qx.ui.form.IField} interface.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: selection {qx.data.IListData|null} List data to select as value.
@param.description: List data to select as value.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {null} The status of this operation.
@return.description: The status of this operation.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: getValue implements part of the {@link qx.ui.form.IField} interface.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.data.IListData} The current selection.
@return.description: The current selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: resetValue implements part of the {@link qx.ui.form.IField} interface.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Apply-method for setting a new selection array. Only the change listener will be removed from the old array and added to the new.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {qx.data.Array} The new data array for the selection.
@param.description: The new data array for the selection.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: old {qx.data.Array|null} The old data array for the selection.
@param.description: The old data array for the selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for the change of the data array holding the selection. If a change is in the selection array, the selection update will be invoked.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for a change in the target selection. If the selection in the target has changed, the selected model objects will be found and added to the selection array.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper method which should be called by the classes including this Mixin when the target changes.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {qx.ui.core.Widget|null} The new target.
@param.description: The new target.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: old {qx.ui.core.Widget|null} The old target.
@param.description: The old target.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Method for updating the selection. It checks for the case of single or multi selection and after that checks if the selection in the selection array is the same as in the target widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper-method returning true, if the target supports multi selection.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true, if the target supports multi selection.
@return.description: true, if the target supports multi selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper-method returning true, if the target supports single selection.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true, if the target supports single selection.
@return.description: true, if the target supports single selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal helper for selecting an item in the target. The item to select is defined by a given model item.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: item {qx.core.Object} A model element.
@param.description: A model element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the list item storing the given model in its model property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: model {var} The representing model of a selectable.
@param.description: The representing model of a selectable.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Object|null} List item or null if none was found
@return.description: List item or null if none was found

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper-Method signaling that currently the selection of the target is in change. That will block the change of the internal selection. {@link #_endSelectionModification}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper-Method signaling that the internal changing of the targets selection is over. {@link #_startSelectionModification}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper-Method for checking the state of the selection modification. {@link #startSelectionModification} {@link #endSelectionModification}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if selection modification is active
@return.description: true if selection modification is active

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The bind method delegates the call to the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
   the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
   the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
   be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
   be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: targetProperty {String} The property name of the target object.
@param.description: The property name of the target object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map?null} A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{var} Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
   for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
   id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.description:
Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
   for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
   id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).
@throws.description:
If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).

@description.name: @description

@param.name: @param

   the source property.

The property chain which represents
   the source property.

The object which the source should
   be bind to.

@param.description: The property name of the target object.

options {Map} A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more

@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} A promise which is resolved when the initial value
 	 has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
   values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
   The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
   an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.description:
A promise which is resolved when the initial value
 	 has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
   values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
   The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
   an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).
@throws.description:
If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes the binding with the given id from the current object. The id has to be the id returned by any of the bind functions.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {var} The id of the binding.
@param.description: The id of the binding.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the binding could not be found.
@throws.description: If the binding could not be found.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all bindings between the object and the related one.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
relatedObject {qx.core.Object} The object of which related
   bindings should be removed.
@param.description:
The object of which related
   bindings should be removed.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.
@throws.description:
If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all bindings from the object.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the object is not in the internal
   registry of the bindings.
@throws.description:
If the object is not in the internal
   registry of the bindings.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.
@throws.description:
If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array which lists all bindings for the object.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array} An array of binding informations. Every binding
   information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
   targetObject and targetProperty in that order.
@return.description:
An array of binding informations. Every binding
   information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
   targetObject and targetProperty in that order.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an error message with the current stack trace

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper that calls the appropriate logger function with the current object and any number of items.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: level {String} The log level of the message
@param.description: The log level of the message

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {arguments} Arguments list to be logged
@param.description: Arguments list to be logged

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add event listener to this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object ? null} Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.
@param.description:
Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add event listener to this object, which is only called once. After the listener is called the event listener gets removed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object ? window} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove event listener from this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: self {Object ? null} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean} Whether to remove the event listener of
   the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to remove the event listener of
   the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.description: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes an event listener from an event target by an id returned by {@link #addListener}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} The id returned by {@link #addListener}
@param.description: The id returned by {@link #addListener}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.description: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check if there are one or more listeners for an event type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to check for listeners of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to check for listeners of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the object has a listener of the given type.
@return.description: Whether the object has a listener of the given type.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Dispatch an event on this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: evt {qx.event.type.Event} event to dispatch
@param.description: event to dispatch

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean|qx.Promise} whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an event on this object; equivalent to fireEvent, except that it always returns a promise

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected
@return.description:
a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create an event object and dispatch it on this object. The event dispatched with this method does never bubble! Use only if you are sure that bubbling is not required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create an event object and dispatch it on this object; equivalent to fireNonBubblingEvent, except that it always returns a promise. The event dispatched with this method does never bubble! Use only if you are sure that bubbling is not required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected
@return.description:
a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an non-bubbling data event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} User defined data attached to the event object
@param.description: User defined data attached to the event object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: oldData {var?null} The event's old data (optional)
@param.description: The event's old data (optional)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean|qx.Promise} whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an non-bubbling data event on this object; equivalent to fireEvent, except that it always returns a promise.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} User defined data attached to the event object
@param.description: User defined data attached to the event object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: oldData {var?null} The event's old data (optional)
@param.description: The event's old data (optional)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected
@return.description:
a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets multiple properties at once by using a property list or sets one property and its value by the first and second argument. As a fallback, if no generated property setter could be found, a handwritten setter will be searched and invoked if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {Map | String} a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.
@param.description: a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var?} the value, only used when data is a string.
@param.description: the value, only used when data is a string.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Object} Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.
@return.description: Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the value of the given property. If no generated getter could be found, a fallback tries to access a handwritten getter.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property.
@param.description: Name of the property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The value of the value
@return.description: The value of the value

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the value of the given property. If no generated resetter could be found, a handwritten resetter will be invoked, if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property.
@param.description: Name of the property.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the property is initialized, i.e. has a defined init value or has got a value by a setter method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property
@param.description: Name of the property

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} If the property is initialized
@return.description: If the property is initialized

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the property defined does not exist
@throws.description: If the property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Apply owner

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Apply objectId

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Called when a child's objectId changes

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Reflect changes to IDs or owners

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the object with the specified ID

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
id
          {String} ID of the object
@param.description: ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.core.Object?} the found object
@return.description: the found object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the object and adds it to a list; most classes are expected to override _createQxObjectImpl NOT this method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} ID of the object
@param.description: ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.core.Object?} the created object
@return.description: the created object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the object, intended to be overridden. Null is a valid return value and will be cached by getQxObject, however undefined is NOT a valid value and so will not be cached meaning that _createQxObjectImpl will be called multiple times until a valid value is returned.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} ID of the object
@param.description: ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.core.Object?} the created object
@return.description: the created object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds an object as owned by this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: obj {qx.core.Object} the object to register
@param.description: the object to register

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String?} the id to set when registering the object
@param.description: the id to set when registering the object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Discards an object from the list of owned objects; note that this does not dispose of the object, simply forgets it if it exists.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: args {String|Object} the ID of the object to discard, or the object itself
@param.description: the ID of the object to discard, or the object itself

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes an owned object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: obj {qx.core.Object} the object
@param.description: the object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array of objects that are owned by this object, or an empty array if none exists.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxObjectId. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that the condition evaluates to true.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: condition {var} Condition to check for. Must evaluate to true.
@param.description: Condition to check for. Must evaluate to true.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String?} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Raise an {@link AssertionError}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: compact {Boolean?false} Show less verbose message. Default: false.
@param.description: Show less verbose message. Default: false.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that the value is true (Identity check).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {Boolean} Condition to check for. Must be identical to true.
@param.description: Condition to check for. Must be identical to true.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String?} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that the value is false (Identity check).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {Boolean} Condition to check for. Must be identical to false.
@param.description: Condition to check for. Must be identical to false.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String?} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that both values are equal. (Uses the equality operator ==.)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: expected {var} Reference value
@param.description: Reference value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: found {var} found value
@param.description: found value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String?} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that both values are not equal. (Uses the not equality operator !=.)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: expected {var} Reference value
@param.description: Reference value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: found {var} found value
@param.description: found value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String?} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that both float values are equal. This might be needed because of the natural floating point inaccuracy of computers.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: expected {Float} Reference value
@param.description: Reference value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: found {Float} Found value
@param.description: Found value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String?} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that both float values are not equal. This might be needed because of the natural floating point inaccuracy of computers.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: expected {Float} Reference value
@param.description: Reference value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: found {Float} Found value
@param.description: Found value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String?} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that both values are identical. (Uses the identity operator ===.)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: expected {var} Reference value
@param.description: Reference value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: found {var} found value
@param.description: found value

@param.name: @param

@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description

@param.description: found value

@param.name: @param

@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that an event is fired.

@param.description: The object on which the event should be fired.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: event {String} The event which should be fired.
@param.description: The event which should be fired.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
invokeFunc {Function} The function which will be invoked and which
   fires the event.
@param.description:
The function which will be invoked and which
   fires the event.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
listener {Function?null} The function which will be invoked in the
   listener. The function has one parameter called e which is the event.
@param.description:
The function which will be invoked in the
   listener. The function has one parameter called e which is the event.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String?""} Message to be shows if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shows if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that an event is not fired.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: obj {Object} The object on which the event should be fired.
@param.description: The object on which the event should be fired.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: event {String} The event which should be fired.
@param.description: The event which should be fired.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:

   should not fire the event.
@param.description:
The function which will be invoked and which
   should not fire the event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Asserts that the callback raises a matching exception.

@param.body: callback {Function} function to check
@param.description: function to check

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
exception {Error?Error} Expected constructor of the exception.
   The assertion fails if the raised exception is not an instance of the
   parameter.
@param.description:
Expected constructor of the exception.
   The assertion fails if the raised exception is not an instance of the
   parameter.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
re {String|RegExp} The assertion fails if the error message does
   not match this parameter
@param.description:
The assertion fails if the error message does
   not match this parameter

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property model. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property model. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property model. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
This event is fired as soon as the content of the selection property changes, but this is not equal to the change of the selection of the widget. If the selection of the widget changes, the content of the array stored in the selection property changes. This means you have to listen to the change event of the selection array to get an event as soon as the user changes the selected item. 

obj.getSelection().addListener("change", listener, this);

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fires after the value was modified
